about.title: About Me
highlights: Practical, loving guidance for everyday life
about.body:
For over a decade I have worked as a physiotherapist supporting children with disabilities and developmental delays. In these years I have experienced both the magic—and the limits—of traditional methods.

During intensive Therasuit work I spent three hours a day over two to five weeks with one child. Sometimes, despite all the effort and care, progress was slow or absent. Children told me they were doing exactly what I asked—“I am stretching my legs!”—and yet I could see their knees still slightly bent. Their frustration mirrored my own. Something was missing.

Curiosity and compassion led me beyond the conventional. I discovered the book Symphony of Reflexes by Bonnie Brandes and a new dimension: the integration of primitive reflexes. In 2019 I trained in Quantum Reflex Integration (QRI) in Madrid. That changed everything.

When I began integrating QRI into sessions the results were unmistakable. Children progressed faster—more confidently—not because they suddenly learned new skills but because tension finally eased. Cold-laser stimulation and reflex integration helped regulate the nervous system, calm cortisol and adrenaline, and unlock movement patterns already within them.

Today I combine QRI with the core tools of physiotherapy: movement, exercises and gentle touch. For some children body guidance alone is enough. For others QRI is the missing piece. My goal in every case is the same: calm the nervous system so the child feels safe enough to grow.

Healing begins with understanding, continues with the right tools, and unfolds in connection. That is what I bring to every session, every course, every moment of this work.

services.title: With Reflex Integration
bullets: More calm, better focus and emotional balance—without pressure
Improved learning ability—by maturing brain systems
From a caring expert—over 10 years with special children
You have tried so much—yet your child doesn’t really move forward.
You see your child trying, but it still doesn’t work—things remain hard, emotional, conflict-filled.
That’s what I experienced as a therapist too. Only after working with QRI did the turning point come.

services3.title: “He could if he wanted to”
bullets: Often, no—because the nervous system is in survival mode.
Unintegrated primitive reflexes keep many children in the brainstem—no logic, no focus, no “pull yourself together”.
What looks like defiance or laziness is often pure overwhelm in the body.
Am I asking too much? Can the child do this—physiologically? If not, the child isn’t wrong—the demand is premature.
You should only ask of someone what they can actually do.

section2.title: 2. Purpose of Processing, Categories of Data, Legal Basis

sub1.legal: Legal basis: Art. 6(1)(b) GDPR (contractual or pre-contractual measures) and Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR (legitimate interest in secure authentication).

sub2.title: 2.2 Content Management & Training Functions
sub2.data: Data: Exercise content and assignments, plans assigned to users (days/cycles), progress records (completion, painScore, free-text comment).
sub2.purpose: Purpose: To create and assign exercises, record user progress, and provide the service.
sub2.note: Note on special categories: User-entered values such as 'painScore' and comments may contain health-related information. Such data is processed only with your explicit consent and solely for the stated purpose (Art. 9(2)(a) GDPR). You may withdraw your consent at any time with effect for the future.

sub3.title: 2.3 Media Uploads (Cloudinary)
sub3.data: Data: Uploaded image/video files and related technical metadata (URL, resolution, duration).
sub3.purpose: Purpose: To securely store and display media within the application.
sub3.legal: Legal basis: Art. 6(1)(b) GDPR; also legitimate interest (Art. 6(1)(f)) – efficient content delivery.

sub4.title: 2.4 Sessions and Essential Cookies
sub4.data: Data: NextAuth session cookies and technical log data (e.g., IP, user agent, session duration).
sub4.purpose: Purpose: To maintain sessions, ensure security, and debug issues.
sub4.legal: Legal basis: §165(3) TKG (strictly necessary) and Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR.

sub5.title: 2.5 Usage Analytics (Google Analytics – only with consent)
sub5.data: Data: Page views, events, device and browser data (via cookies or similar technologies).
sub5.purpose: Purpose: Anonymous or pseudonymous usage analysis to improve the product.
sub5.legal: Legal basis: Art. 6(1)(a) GDPR (consent). Analytics is activated only if you consent to cookies and/or a GA-ID is configured.

sub6.title: 2.6 Appointment and Communication Integrations

Analytics cookies: Set only with explicit consent; can be revoked at any time via browser or cookie settings.

section9.title: 9. Data Security
